29#include <isc/log.h>
30#include <isc/platform.h>
31#include <isc/print.h>

38#define NS_PER_S 1000000000 /*%< Nanoseconds per second. */
39#define NS_PER_US 1000 /*%< Nanoseconds per microsecond. */
40#define NS_PER_MS 1000000 /*%< Nanoseconds per millisecond. */
41#define US_PER_S 1000000 /*%< Microseconds per second. */
42
43/*
44 * All of the INSIST()s checks of nanoseconds < NS_PER_S are for
45 * consistency checking of the type. In lieu of magic numbers, it
46 * is the best we've got. The check is only performed on functions which
47 * need an initialized type.
48 */
49
50#ifndef ISC_FIX_TV_USEC
51#define ISC_FIX_TV_USEC 1
52#endif
53
54/*%
55 *** Intervals
56 ***/
57
58static const isc_interval_t zero_interval = { 0, 0 };
59const isc_interval_t * const isc_interval_zero = &zero_interval;
60
61#if ISC_FIX_TV_USEC
62static inline void
63fix_tv_usec(struct timeval *tv) {
64 bool fixed = false;
65
66 if (tv->tv_usec < 0) {
67 fixed = true;
68 do {
69 tv->tv_sec -= 1;
70 tv->tv_usec += US_PER_S;
71 } while (tv->tv_usec < 0);
72 } else if (tv->tv_usec >= US_PER_S) {
73 fixed = true;
74 do {
75 tv->tv_sec += 1;
76 tv->tv_usec -= US_PER_S;
77 } while (tv->tv_usec >=US_PER_S);
78 }
79 /*
80 * Call syslog directly as was are called from the logging functions.
81 */
82 if (fixed)
83 (void)syslog(LOG_ERR, "gettimeofday returned bad tv_usec: corrected");
84}
85#endif
86
87void
88isc_interval_set(isc_interval_t *i,
89 unsigned int seconds, unsigned int nanoseconds)
90{
91 REQUIRE(i != NULL);
92 REQUIRE(nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
93
94 i->seconds = seconds;
95 i->nanoseconds = nanoseconds;
96}
97
98bool
99isc_interval_iszero(const isc_interval_t *i) {
100 REQUIRE(i != NULL);
101 INSIST(i->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
102
103 if (i->seconds == 0 && i->nanoseconds == 0)
104 return (true);
105
106 return (false);
107}
108
109
110/***
111 *** Absolute Times
112 ***/
113
114static const isc_time_t epoch = { 0, 0 };
115const isc_time_t * const isc_time_epoch = &epoch;
116
117void
118isc_time_set(isc_time_t *t, unsigned int seconds, unsigned int nanoseconds) {
119 REQUIRE(t != NULL);
120 REQUIRE(nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
121
122 t->seconds = seconds;
123 t->nanoseconds = nanoseconds;
124}
125
126void
127isc_time_settoepoch(isc_time_t *t) {
128 REQUIRE(t != NULL);
129
130 t->seconds = 0;
131 t->nanoseconds = 0;
132}
133
134bool
135isc_time_isepoch(const isc_time_t *t) {
136 REQUIRE(t != NULL);
137 INSIST(t->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
138
139 if (t->seconds == 0 && t->nanoseconds == 0)
140 return (true);
141
142 return (false);
143}
144
145
146isc_result_t
147isc_time_now(isc_time_t *t) {
148 struct timeval tv;
149 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
150
151 REQUIRE(t != NULL);
152
153 if (gettimeofday(&tv, NULL) == -1) {
154 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
155 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__, "%s", strbuf);
156 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
157 }
158
159 /*
160 * Does POSIX guarantee the signedness of tv_sec and tv_usec? If not,
161 * then this test will generate warnings for platforms on which it is
162 * unsigned. In any event, the chances of any of these problems
163 * happening are pretty much zero, but since the libisc library ensures
164 * certain things to be true ...
165 */
166#if ISC_FIX_TV_USEC
167 fix_tv_usec(&tv);
168 if (tv.tv_sec < 0)
169 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
170#else
171 if (tv.tv_sec < 0 || tv.tv_usec < 0 || tv.tv_usec >= US_PER_S)
172 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
173#endif
174
175 /*
176 * Ensure the tv_sec value fits in t->seconds.
177 */
178 if (sizeof(tv.tv_sec) > sizeof(t->seconds) &&
179 ((tv.tv_sec | (unsigned int)-1) ^ (unsigned int)-1) != 0U)
180 return (ISC_R_RANGE);
181
182 t->seconds = tv.tv_sec;
183 t->nanoseconds = tv.tv_usec * NS_PER_US;
184
185 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
186}
187
188isc_result_t
189isc_time_nowplusinterval(isc_time_t *t, const isc_interval_t *i) {
190 struct timeval tv;
191 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
192
193 REQUIRE(t != NULL);
194 REQUIRE(i != NULL);
195 INSIST(i->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
196
197 if (gettimeofday(&tv, NULL) == -1) {
198 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
199 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__, "%s", strbuf);
200 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
201 }
202
203 /*
204 * Does POSIX guarantee the signedness of tv_sec and tv_usec? If not,
205 * then this test will generate warnings for platforms on which it is
206 * unsigned. In any event, the chances of any of these problems
207 * happening are pretty much zero, but since the libisc library ensures
208 * certain things to be true ...
209 */
210#if ISC_FIX_TV_USEC
211 fix_tv_usec(&tv);
212 if (tv.tv_sec < 0)
213 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
214#else
215 if (tv.tv_sec < 0 || tv.tv_usec < 0 || tv.tv_usec >= US_PER_S)
216 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
217#endif
218
219 /*
220 * Ensure the resulting seconds value fits in the size of an
221 * unsigned int. (It is written this way as a slight optimization;
222 * note that even if both values == INT_MAX, then when added
223 * and getting another 1 added below the result is UINT_MAX.)
224 */
225 if ((tv.tv_sec > INT_MAX || i->seconds > INT_MAX) &&
226 ((long long)tv.tv_sec + i->seconds > UINT_MAX))
227 return (ISC_R_RANGE);
228
229 t->seconds = tv.tv_sec + i->seconds;
230 t->nanoseconds = tv.tv_usec * NS_PER_US + i->nanoseconds;
231 if (t->nanoseconds >= NS_PER_S) {
232 t->seconds++;
233 t->nanoseconds -= NS_PER_S;
234 }
235
236 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
237}
238
239int
240isc_time_compare(const isc_time_t *t1, const isc_time_t *t2) {
241 REQUIRE(t1 != NULL && t2 != NULL);
242 INSIST(t1->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S && t2->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
243
244 if (t1->seconds < t2->seconds)
245 return (-1);
246 if (t1->seconds > t2->seconds)
247 return (1);
248 if (t1->nanoseconds < t2->nanoseconds)
249 return (-1);
250 if (t1->nanoseconds > t2->nanoseconds)
251 return (1);
252 return (0);
253}
254
255isc_result_t
256isc_time_add(const isc_time_t *t, const isc_interval_t *i, isc_time_t *result)
257{
258 REQUIRE(t != NULL && i != NULL && result != NULL);
259 INSIST(t->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S && i->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
260
261 /*
262 * Ensure the resulting seconds value fits in the size of an
263 * unsigned int. (It is written this way as a slight optimization;
264 * note that even if both values == INT_MAX, then when added
265 * and getting another 1 added below the result is UINT_MAX.)
266 */
267 if ((t->seconds > INT_MAX || i->seconds > INT_MAX) &&
268 ((long long)t->seconds + i->seconds > UINT_MAX))
269 return (ISC_R_RANGE);
270
271 result->seconds = t->seconds + i->seconds;
272 result->nanoseconds = t->nanoseconds + i->nanoseconds;
273 if (result->nanoseconds >= NS_PER_S) {
274 result->seconds++;
275 result->nanoseconds -= NS_PER_S;
276 }
277
278 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
279}
280
281isc_result_t
282isc_time_subtract(const isc_time_t *t, const isc_interval_t *i,
283 isc_time_t *result)
284{
285 REQUIRE(t != NULL && i != NULL && result != NULL);
286 INSIST(t->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S && i->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
287
288 if ((unsigned int)t->seconds < i->seconds ||
289 ((unsigned int)t->seconds == i->seconds &&
290 t->nanoseconds < i->nanoseconds))
291 return (ISC_R_RANGE);
292
293 result->seconds = t->seconds - i->seconds;
294 if (t->nanoseconds >= i->nanoseconds)
295 result->nanoseconds = t->nanoseconds - i->nanoseconds;
296 else {
297 result->nanoseconds = NS_PER_S - i->nanoseconds +
298 t->nanoseconds;
299 result->seconds--;
300 }
301
302 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
303}
304
305uint64_t
306isc_time_microdiff(const isc_time_t *t1, const isc_time_t *t2) {
307 uint64_t i1, i2, i3;
308
309 REQUIRE(t1 != NULL && t2 != NULL);
310 INSIST(t1->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S && t2->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
311
312 i1 = (uint64_t)t1->seconds * NS_PER_S + t1->nanoseconds;
313 i2 = (uint64_t)t2->seconds * NS_PER_S + t2->nanoseconds;
314
315 if (i1 <= i2)
316 return (0);
317
318 i3 = i1 - i2;
319
320 /*
321 * Convert to microseconds.
322 */
323 i3 /= NS_PER_US;
324
325 return (i3);
326}
327
328uint32_t
329isc_time_seconds(const isc_time_t *t) {
330 REQUIRE(t != NULL);
331 INSIST(t->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
332
333 return ((uint32_t)t->seconds);
334}
335
336isc_result_t
337isc_time_secondsastimet(const isc_time_t *t, time_t *secondsp) {
338 time_t seconds, i;
339
340 REQUIRE(t != NULL);
341 INSIST(t->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
342
343 /*
344 * Ensure that the number of seconds represented by t->seconds
345 * can be represented by a time_t. Since t->seconds is an unsigned
346 * int and since time_t is mostly opaque, this is trickier than
347 * it seems. (This standardized opaqueness of time_t is *very*
348 * frustrating; time_t is not even limited to being an integral
349 * type.)
350 *
351 * The mission, then, is to avoid generating any kind of warning
352 * about "signed versus unsigned" while trying to determine if the
353 * the unsigned int t->seconds is out range for tv_sec, which is
354 * pretty much only true if time_t is a signed integer of the same
355 * size as the return value of isc_time_seconds.
356 *
357 * If the paradox in the if clause below is true, t->seconds is out
358 * of range for time_t.
359 */
360 seconds = (time_t)t->seconds;
361
362 INSIST(sizeof(unsigned int) == sizeof(uint32_t));
363 INSIST(sizeof(time_t) >= sizeof(uint32_t));
364
365 if (sizeof(time_t) == sizeof(uint32_t) && /* Same size. */
366 (time_t)0.5 != 0.5 && /* Not a floating point type. */
367 (i = (time_t)-1) != 4294967295u && /* Is signed. */
368 (seconds &
369 (1ULL << (sizeof(time_t) * CHAR_BIT - 1))) != 0ULL) { /* Negative. */
370 /*
371 * This UNUSED() is here to shut up the IRIX compiler:
372 * variable "i" was set but never used
373 * when the value of i *was* used in the third test.
374 * (Let's hope the compiler got the actual test right.)
375 */
376 UNUSED(i);
377 return (ISC_R_RANGE);
378 }
379
380 *secondsp = seconds;
381
382 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
383}
384
385uint32_t
386isc_time_nanoseconds(const isc_time_t *t) {
387 REQUIRE(t != NULL);
388
389 ENSURE(t->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
390
391 return ((uint32_t)t->nanoseconds);
392}
393
394void
395isc_time_formattimestamp(const isc_time_t *t, char *buf, unsigned int len) {
396 time_t now;
397 unsigned int flen;
398 struct tm tm;
399
400 REQUIRE(t != NULL);
401 INSIST(t->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
402 REQUIRE(buf != NULL);
403 REQUIRE(len > 0);
404
405 now = (time_t) t->seconds;
406 flen = strftime(buf, len, "%d-%b-%Y %X", localtime_r(&now, &tm));
407 INSIST(flen < len);
408 if (flen != 0)
409 snprintf(buf + flen, len - flen,
410 ".%03u", t->nanoseconds / NS_PER_MS);
411 else {
412 strlcpy(buf, "99-Bad-9999 99:99:99.999", len);
413 }
414}
415
416void
417isc_time_formathttptimestamp(const isc_time_t *t, char *buf, unsigned int len) {
418 time_t now;
419 unsigned int flen;
420 struct tm tm;
421
422 REQUIRE(t != NULL);
423 INSIST(t->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
424 REQUIRE(buf != NULL);
425 REQUIRE(len > 0);
426
427 /*
428 * 5 spaces, 1 comma, 3 GMT, 2 %d, 4 %Y, 8 %H:%M:%S, 3+ %a, 3+ %b (29+)
429 */
430 now = (time_t)t->seconds;
431 flen = strftime(buf, len, "%a, %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S GMT",
432 gmtime_r(&now, &tm));
433 INSIST(flen < len);
434}
435
436isc_result_t
437isc_time_parsehttptimestamp(char *buf, isc_time_t *t) {
438 struct tm t_tm;
439 time_t when;
440 char *p;
441
442 REQUIRE(buf != NULL);
443 REQUIRE(t != NULL);
444
445 p = isc_tm_strptime(buf, "%a, %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S", &t_tm);
446 if (p == NULL)
447 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
448 when = isc_tm_timegm(&t_tm);
449 if (when == -1)
450 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
451 isc_time_set(t, when, 0);
452 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
453}
454
455void
456isc_time_formatISO8601L(const isc_time_t *t, char *buf, unsigned int len) {
457 time_t now;
458 unsigned int flen;
459 struct tm tm;
460
461 REQUIRE(t != NULL);
462 INSIST(t->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
463 REQUIRE(buf != NULL);
464 REQUIRE(len > 0);
465
466 now = (time_t)t->seconds;
467 flen = strftime(buf, len, "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S", localtime_r(&now, &tm));
468 INSIST(flen < len);
469}
470
471void
472isc_time_formatISO8601Lms(const isc_time_t *t, char *buf, unsigned int len) {
473 time_t now;
474 unsigned int flen;
475 struct tm tm;
476
477 REQUIRE(t != NULL);
478 INSIST(t->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
479 REQUIRE(buf != NULL);
480 REQUIRE(len > 0);
481
482 now = (time_t)t->seconds;
483 flen = strftime(buf, len, "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S", localtime_r(&now, &tm));
484 INSIST(flen < len);
485 if (flen > 0U && len - flen >= 6) {
486 snprintf(buf + flen, len - flen, ".%03u",
487 t->nanoseconds / NS_PER_MS);
488 }
489}
490
491void
492isc_time_formatISO8601(const isc_time_t *t, char *buf, unsigned int len) {
493 time_t now;
494 unsigned int flen;
495 struct tm tm;
496
497 REQUIRE(t != NULL);
498 INSIST(t->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
499 REQUIRE(buf != NULL);
500 REQUIRE(len > 0);
501
502 now = (time_t)t->seconds;
503 flen = strftime(buf, len, "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ", gmtime_r(&now, &tm));
504 INSIST(flen < len);
505}
506
507void
508isc_time_formatISO8601ms(const isc_time_t *t, char *buf, unsigned int len) {
509 time_t now;
510 unsigned int flen;
511 struct tm tm;
512
513 REQUIRE(t != NULL);
514 INSIST(t->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
515 REQUIRE(buf != NULL);
516 REQUIRE(len > 0);
517
518 now = (time_t)t->seconds;
519 flen = strftime(buf, len, "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ", gmtime_r(&now, &tm));
520 INSIST(flen < len);
521 if (flen > 0U && len - flen >= 5) {
522 flen -= 1; /* rewind one character (Z) */
523 snprintf(buf + flen, len - flen, ".%03uZ",
524 t->nanoseconds / NS_PER_MS);
525 }
526}
527
528void
529isc_time_formatshorttimestamp(const isc_time_t *t, char *buf, unsigned int len)
530{
531 time_t now;
532 unsigned int flen;
533 struct tm tm;
534
535 REQUIRE(t != NULL);
536 INSIST(t->nanoseconds < NS_PER_S);
537 REQUIRE(buf != NULL);
538 REQUIRE(len > 0);
539
540 now = (time_t)t->seconds;
541 flen = strftime(buf, len, "%Y%m%d%H%M%S", gmtime_r(&now, &tm));
542 INSIST(flen < len);
543 if (flen > 0U && len - flen >= 5) {
544 snprintf(buf + flen, len - flen, "%03u",
545 t->nanoseconds / NS_PER_MS);
546 }
547}
